subject: Leadership
title: Team Retrospectives
description: A micro-lesson that makes Team Retrospectives usable.

hook.text: An agile team holds retros every two weeks. Over a year, they improve velocity by 60%â€”just from reflecting.

buildup.text: Retrospectives are structured reflections: what went well, what didn't, and what to change. They close the loop.

discovery.text: The power isn't in the formatâ€”it's the habit. Regular reflection compounds small improvements into big gains.

twist.text: Most retros fail because action items die. Pick one change, assign an owner, and follow up next session.

climax.text: Effective retros feel safe, stay focused, and always end with a concrete commitment the team tracks together.

punchline.text: Reflection without action is just nostalgia.
